data.name: ToSarcastic
data.description:
Somehow, a Meme about a yellow Sponge found a reliable Way of expressing Sarcasm without needing special punctuation or explicit declaration.  
To use this format, there are but a few rules to follow:

  1. Two consecutive letters, never have the same case (upper- or lowercase)
  2. A letter consecutive to another letter, is always in the opposite case
  3. Any Symbol that hasn't a discernible upper- or lowercase representation, is ignored

Here are some quick examples to showcase those rules:

```
type Annotations are for Dummies. -> tYpE AnNoTaTiOnS aRe fOr DuMmIeS.

Strict Compare is for Loosers. -> StRiCt CoMpaRe iS fOr LoOsErS.

If It was hüÖ∞Ô∏èrd to write, it sh00ld be h4rd tO read! -> If It wAs hüÖ∞Ô∏èrD tO wRiTe, iT sH00ld bE h4rD tO rEaD!
```

Typing this way becomes quite bothersome, to help our Users, we will create a new function with this signature:

```typescript
function toSarcastic(input: string) : string;
```

During validation input will always be a non-empty UTF-8 string.
